benchmark_details.name: Geoperception
benchmark_details.overview: Geoperception is a benchmark designed to evaluate an MLLMâ€™s ability to accurately transcribe 2D geometric information from an image. It reveals shortcomings in precise geometric perception across leading vision-language MLLMs, both closed and open-source.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct a benchmark focusing solely on the geometric perception ability of MLLMs.

data.source: Derived from the Geometry-3K corpus, which compiles problems from high school textbooks.
data.size: 1,584 images with multiple questions across 7 tasks
data.annotation: Questions and answers generated directly from logical forms validated by GPT-4.

methodology.calculation: The evaluation score is defined as |P| / |G| if P is a subset of G, otherwise 0.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better geometric perception capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Closed-source models, such as Gemini-1.5-Pro, achieved an average score of 56.98%.
